author: ansgar.eth
content:
I'll add more details for the Glamsterdam scoping section, but idea is to get through as many of the outstanding EIP decisions as possible today.

Glamsterdam scope should then be fully finalized by Jan 5.

author: ansgar.eth
content:
I also confirmed the decisons made on last call, and just merged the corresponding meta EIP PR by <@731289513942450317> .

notes there:
- EIP-8070 not yet reflected as CFI, pending ACDC confirmation
- EIP-7619 was DFI'd, but not yet listed in meta EIP at all
- EIP-8051 still PFI, but not yet listed in meta EIP at all

author: cperezz.eth
content:
<@415548822983278593>  I haven't had the chance to PR to the Meta EIP. 

But can we count 8058 as DFI'd (unless all teams want it so hard which is not the case AFAIK).

I'd prefer to withdraw it so we can focus on repricings for scaling which will be more impactful.

author: big_tech_sux
content:
i didn't speak up on the call due to time constraints (i had a screwup with time zones and arrived 1hr late, so missed the discussion about eip-7923) but i think that eip-7923 should be reconsidered for inclusion in lieu of eip-8024 inclusion as argued here:
https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-8024-backward-compatible-swapn-dupn-exchange/25486/3

mario vega mentioned he has a concern about testing surface but i didn't hear any other concerns. the eip has a strong design imo and users (and compilers) have been asking to fix the memory model pretty much since inception.
